summary: Ivan Conrad was a former Assistant Director at the FBI. The documents indicate his involvement in FBI investigations, specifically those related to Martin Luther King Jr. and electronic surveillance activities. He was interviewed by the Senate Select Committee (SSC) regarding these investigations. The documents also mention the Senate Select Committee's interest in the FBI's involvement in domestic intelligence and counterintelligence activities, including those related to Martin Luther King Jr., as well as the Huston Plan and COINTELPRO. There is a notable pattern of his involvement in sensitive FBI investigations and his subsequent interactions with the Senate Select Committee.
significance: While the documents do not directly link Ivan Conrad to the JFK assassination, his role as a former Assistant Director at the FBI and his involvement in sensitive investigations, including those related to Martin Luther King Jr. and electronic surveillance, place him within the context of intelligence activities that were under scrutiny by the Senate Select Committee. The documents suggest he was a person of interest to the SSC regarding FBI practices and programs.
